channel.description: Girl with Curves is the personal style blog of Tanesha Awasthi, offering outfit inspiration, style and shopping advice.
channel.title: Girl with Curves

item.title: Floral Remix
item.description:
The easiest way to remix a dress?

|WEARING| ModCloth dress worn as top (first worn here), J.Crew Earrings, BCBG Bag, H&M Skirt, The Highest Heel Women’s Brazil Pumps via Amazon (similar here & here)

The easiest way to remix a dress?

By putting a skirt over the bottom half, and wearing it as a top!

item.title: Spotted
item.description:
A suit doesn’t have to be boring.

  

|WEARING| Suit, Blouse & Bag via Marina Rinaldi, Sam Edelman Pumps

A suit doesn’t have to be neutral in color or serious in tone.

This one embodies the fun of Spring and the fierceness of fashion to a tee.

item.title: Current Faves
item.description:
If you’ve been following the blog for the past few months, you may have noticed the name Gwynnie Bee popping up in outfit posts.

|LINKS TO POSTS| Printed Peplum Jacket, Wrap Dress, Houndstooth & Checkers

 

|LINK TO POST| Readdress the Dress

 

If you’ve been following the blog for a while, you may have noticed the name Gwynnie Bee popping up in outfit posts lately. I’ve been using the service over the last several months, and words can’t express how much I love and appreciate the concept!

 

Gwynnie Bee is the only service of its kind, which allows members to borrow clothing (in sizes 10-26) without the commitment of buying.  As a girl who loves to shop, I’m obsessed with the notion of borrowing versus buying!

 

This month, I’ve teamed-up with Gwynnie Bee to share my fave picks from the collection, along with a few style tips.

 

Check out my entire collection of faves here, my guest post on the Gwynnie Bee blog, and sign-up for your own 30 day free trial.

item.title: Polished
item.description:
In the game of fashion, one thing’s always true…

|WEARING| Forever 21 Blazer (similar here & here), H&M Top (similar here in +), Zara Necklace, Vintage necklace worn as bracelet, Old Navy Skinnies,

BCBG Clutch (similar here), Sam Edelman Pumps (similar here)

In the game of fashion, one thing’s always true: a blazer polishes off an outfit perfectly.

item.title: Curly Q's
item.description:
As a committed curly girl- meaning I love my natural curls and try to keep them as healthy as possible, I get lots of questions about my hair care routine.  

Here’s a collection of FAQ’s related to my curly locks.

|PRODUCTS| Kerastase Bain Nutri-Thermique Shampoo and Masque (used as conditioner) | Kerastase Deep Conditioning Treatment (Salon Only) |

Loreal Richesse Hair Color (Salon Only) | Vital Care ‘Mega Hold All Day Sports Gel’

item.title: Culottes
item.description:
Culottes aren’t typically considered chic or glamorous…

  

|WEARING| Asos Crop Top (similar here) & Culottes (here in + size), Michael Kors Bag, Vintage Bracelet, Sam Edelman Pumps (similar here), MAC Lippy in ‘Love Lorn’

 

Culottes aren’t typically considered chic or glamorous…

but with their vintage silhouette, and high waisted, wide leg yumminess, they’re making a major comeback!

item.title: redbook
item.description:
So excited to be one of three women contributing to redbook magazine’s monthly column.

|WEARING| Forever 21 blouse (similar here), Merona belt via Target, Skirt thanks to Mark of Style by Mark Zunino for QVC, Earrings via eBay, Forever 21 beaded clutch (similar here), Nine West Heels

If you follow me on facebook, twitter or instagram, you may have already heard the exciting news a couple weeks ago…

 

I’m one of three women contributing to redbook magazine’s new monthly column One Piece, Three Women! 

The column challenges myself and two other women- all with completely different personal style choices, to style one garment our own way.

This is the ensemble I styled around a pencil skirt, for the April issue (on stands now).

item.title: Seeing Stripes
item.description:
Zebra print takes black and white stripes, to a whole other level.

  

|WEARING| Zara Coat, Forever 21 Blouse (similar here), Kenneth Jay Lane Necklace (similar here), Vintage Bracelet, Skinnies thanks to James Jeans, Michael Kors Bag, Sam Edelman Pumps (similar here)

Black and white stripes are having a major moment for Spring, but how can one take it to the next level?  

By sporting Zebra! the ultimate black and white play on stripes.

item.title: SunKissed Glow
item.description: Thanks to bronzer, the beauty of sunkissed skin can be achieved without baking in the sun!  Here’s how to get the look…

item.title: Print on Print
item.description:
This season, print is in!

|WEARING| Dress, Coat, Necklace & Bag via Marina Rinaldi, Sam Edelman Pumps (similar here), MAC Lippy in ‘Lickable’

This season, print is in, so what better way to make a bold statement, than with a print on print ensemble?

To keep the focus on the prints, neutral accessories are a must.  

Finish the look off with a bold lip and you’re perfectly on trend for Spring!

item.title: Indian Wedding
item.description:
The true beauty of an Indian wedding is in its traditions.

|ABOVE| The bride walking down the aisle | The groom walking to the mandap | Wedding Ceremony | 

The groom being welcomed to the family by the bride’s mother | The bridesmaids | Bridesmaids who stole the groom’s shoes (a fun tradition) | 

The bride putting on gifts of jewelry from the groom’s mother.

The beauty of Indian weddings is in its traditions, celebrations and coming together of family & friends.

Here are some images from the family wedding I attended this past weekend in Tampa, FL.

(And here’s a peek at my double-ceremony wedding day).

item.title: Jeweled
item.description:
My favorite thing about Indian weddings is the fashion.

   

|WEARING| Salwar Kameez Suit & Bangles via Maharani Boutique in San Jose, CA, Gold Bangles & Earrings from India, Ivanka Trump heels

Aside from the song & dance, great food and celebrations, my favorite part of attending an Indian wedding is the fashion!

It’s not everyday that a girl can wear layers of jewel-encrusted fabrics and loads of accessories.

item.title: Readdress The Dress
item.description:
With Spring officially here and the need for a closet update, I’m dependong on a recently discovered treasure called Gwynnie Bee, to keep my wardrobe current and my budget intact.

|ABOVE| Eloquii dress via Gwynnie Bee, Zara Jacket, Michael Kors Bag,

H&M Tights, Sam Edelman Pumps (similar here)

 

|ABOVE| Eloquii dress via Gwynnie Bee, Belt via Target, Nine West Heels,

Vintage Earrings, Clutch thanks to mark.

 

|ABOVE| Eloquii dress via Gwynnie Bee, Forever 21 Sleeveless Blouse (similar here), Dolce Vita Sandals,

Vintage Earrings, Bag thanks to Coach

With Spring officially here and the need for a closet update, I’m depending a lot on a recently discovered treasure called Gwynnie Bee, to keep my wardrobe current and my budget intact.  For those of you who aren’t familiar, Gwynnie Bee is a virtual closet which allows you to borrow amazing fashion for all aspects of your lifestyle, in sizes 10-26. Not only does GB stock seasonal pieces that help keep your closet on trend- they also stock office friendly pieces and luxury labels, which you can borrow at a fraction of the purchase price!  
 
When it comes to fashion and style, I believe in 3 things: affordability (looking chic and polished on a budget), versatility (stretching the wearability of each item in your wardrobe), and when your wardrobe needs a seasonal trend update: borrowing instead of buying! 

 

Of these three concepts, the one I take into consideration most is versatility.  In my experience, the garment that’s known for being shoved to the back of the closet after only being worn once, is the infamous dress, so what better way to demonstrate versatility, than showing how a recent Gwynnie Bee borrow (super on trend for Spring with its bold colored stripes!) can be worn 3 different ways, for 3 different aspects of my lifestyle?!

 

                                         Wanna ramp up your Spring wardrobe by borrowing from Gwynnie Bee? Click here for a free 30 day trial!

item.title: Curvy Confessions
item.description:
We all have those moments when we can do nothing but laugh about ourselves.  

These are just a few popular occurances that come up in my personal circle of curvies.

item.title: Peach
item.description:
Nothing warms up a Winter wardrobe like the color peach.

   

|WEARING| Zara Jacket, Forever 21 Blouse (similar here), Bangles from India, Michael Kors Bag, Jeans thanks to James Jeans,

Zigi Soho Sandals via DSW, MAC Lippy in ‘Ravishing’

As Winter fades and Spring emerges, I like to introduce a warmer color palette into my wardrobe.

This peach topper is quickly becoming my fave Spring staple!

item.title: Neon
item.description:
I never thought I’d embrace the neon trend…

|WEARING| Forever 21 Blouse, Skirt thanks to Asos, Belt via Target, Vintage Earrings, Bangles from India, BCBG Bag, Sam Edelman Pumps (similar here)

I never thought I’d embrace the neon trend, but what better way to conjure Spring, than with a bold shade of citron?!

item.title: Winged Eyeliner
item.description:
My everyday makeup is simple, quick and fuss-free, but sometimes I like a little more drama! For days when I want a little something extra, I add winged eyeliner.

Here’s how to get the look.

Tools:
Liquid Eyeliner or Eyeliner Pen
Q-Tip
Makeup Remover

1 of 5

item.title: Classic Neutrals
item.description:
|WEARING| United Colors of Benetton Jacket, Forever 21 Top, Vintage Bracelet, Michael Kors Bag, Old Navy Skinnies, Top Shop Flats (similar here)

As much as I love color, you can never go wrong with classic black and white.  Throw in hints of gold and an oversize jacket in a muted tone, and you’ve got a classically chic ensemble that never goes out of style.

item.title: Moto
item.description:
I’ve been in search of the perfect moto jacket for as long as I can remember.

  

|WEARING| Jacket thanks to Wilsons Leather (site-wide 30% off SALE happening now!), Wilfred Blouse, Foreign Exchange Clutch (similar here),

Old Navy Skinnies, Enzo Angiolini Pumps (similar here & here)

 

Ever since moto jackets emerged as a wardrobe staple a couple seasons ago, I’ve admired them from afar, thinking I could never pull off such a tough, edgy style.  But fashion isn’t about ignoring things you admire, just because you think they won’t work.  Sometimes, it’s about finding a way to make the trend work with your personal style- putting your own twist on a certain trend, and making it your own.

 

 
That said, I’ve been in search of the perfect leather moto jacket for as long as I can remember, so when Wilsons Leather asked if I wanted to choose one from their latest collection, I couldn’t resist the challenge!  A moto jacket isn’t typically something I’d classify as classic or girly (like the majority of my wardrobe), but when it’s black in color, with a hint of shine, has an asymmetrical zipper, adjustable waist tabs for a custom fit, an oversized collar, and looks good both open and closed, what more could a girl ask for?!  Paired with a ladylike blouse, ankle skinnies and pumps, I’m loving my feminine twist on this edgy trend.

item.title: Ten Things
